description:
I love shopping in Canyon Market when I am in Glen Park and definitely recommend them for catering services as well. Last week I hosted a small friends and family gathering. The catering manager, Josie, assisted with the selection process. There were vegan options for me and plenty of options for the rest of the group. 

Delivery was expensive but perfectly on time. The food was excellent and exactly as expected. The presentation was superb and included cards that described each dish. 

I will definitely use Canyon Market again!
author: Sheila S.

description:
I really like this neighborhood market, which amazingly has many various food and non food products.  Everything here is fresh and is of good quality.  Although it can be pricey, I guarantee you will find your favorite here!

Parking is rare in this neighborhood but it's very close to  Glenn Park Bart station.
author: Ivory B.

description: Took more than 10 mins for a bagel (no visible lines).  I told them to give it whomever (it was getting late to catch my bus), and it looked like the guy gets that alot.  Not worth waiting.
author: David P.

description: I like this market when you need to pick up a few items for dinner. Good selection of cheese and good food selection at the deli.
author: Juan V.

description: Great selections. Not as big as WFM but goid enough fir four stars. They've figured out how to speed-up the cashering for folks buying a few items.
author: Clay O.

description:
TL;DR So much good (expensive) stuff in such a small space!

The store is so small, but boy do they have a lot of stuff. If Whole Foods and Trader Joe's had a baby, and put it in really small area, this is it. There's so much going on in here that it's kinda cramped, but you're most likely going to find what you need here. Their spice, cheese and prepared foods section is very very impressive. However, their produce section isn't as vast. The only down side to Canyon Market are the prices. It seems to be even more expensive than Whole Foods!
author: Sophia L.

description:
A haiku, for my beloved Canyon Market and the lovely people who work here: 

        Fresh sour batard
Sharp Irish cheddar cheeses 
     "I'll just see what's new"
author: Brittany B.

description:
This market teleported me back to the markets in the south of France where small selection is offset by quality and specialty items.

Yes, the prices are heftier here. But shopping is a gastronomical delight. It was easy to geek out over the aged cheeses and steaks, pristine produce, gluten free desserts. Sourdough baguettes.

This delectable store makes Glen Park an even cooler neighborhood.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description: Favorite Market these people really go out of their way to making really good food when we're asleep they're cooking. Wonderful different breads San Francisco Style baked and packaged in this little rustic grocery store. Great salad bar with an array of unique Foods. Need flowers they got them too for reasonable rates. Don't miss this little grocery store. The bakery is wonderful stop by and have a cup of coffee and a croissant or donut
author: Michelle B.

description: Be careful at the deli, I ordered a bbq chicken sandwich which tast really good and then a side of tai pad noodle which was okay not the best Iv had. Then suddenly 10 minuets later I had explosive diarrhea could not get off the toilet for an hour. So be careful in the deli.
author: Thio C.

description:
My goodness was my review outdated!

Wine department - greatly, seriously improved!  See Vicki or David.

Meat department - tragically BN Ranch was sold to Blue Apron in 2017, but it will do in a pinch when I need something grass fed.  I LOVE Oscar the head butcher. Dan is great. Sergio is great.  I don't eat fish other than the properly farmed trout from Mc Farland Springs which they have.  

Cooler/Dairy - I wish they had Living Cultures coconut yogurt so I don't have to be tortured at Rainbow to get it!  It's local (Santa Cruz and fabulously fantastic so dairy buyer if you are reading this - PLEASE!  

Cheese - With cheese this good I guess I'll never be giving up "dairy"  Well, screw it, I'm going to keep eating it, I like it!   Plenty of good goat and sheep imported cheeses.  There's an Italian mozz that I'm addicted to.

I find my personal basics like coconut oil and coconut aminos that I use and need.   There's a locally made pesto in a jar that's fantastic.  I wish they had better non-dairy ice cream (I don't do well with a lot of milky stuff)  Their chocolate area is "ok" but not blow my socks off.  

I like a lot of their cashiers and people on the floor - Quinn cracks me up.  Maria in the personal care area is a doll.  

Maybe one day they'll have a gluten free pizza dough . . .and maybe one day they'll have good gluten free baked goods, but my waistline doesn't really "need" them.  

Great market, totally "local" small, husband/wife owned.
author: Cinnamon Z.

description:
Bravo to Marina Bianchi and the deli staff at Canyon Market! They really took care of us.

My company recently took all of us (125 people) on a trip to Napa Valley. We needed lunch on the bus from SFO to St. Helena, so I was researching gourmet sandwich-makers in the SF area  and came across Canyon Market as highly-rated in the deli department.

Compared to Dean & Deluca, the lunch package Marina offered to us was of a greater value and not as costly as the standard D&D lunch box. Marina worked with me to ensure that every member of my company had the sandwich and wine of their choice (even modifying for our gluten-free people).

Our company is a luxury interior design firm so everyone is used to having the best of the best, and when we finally enjoyed our carefully coordinated lunches (had to split orders over three buses worth of people!), everyone commented on how tasty and healthy the food was and how great the cans of wine Marina recommended were (easiest way to drink wine on the go--excellent suggestion!). Everything was organized and packaged like perfect little gift bags. It was a coordinator's dream.

Thank you, Marina, and everyone at Canyon Market for your patient customer service and attention to detail! Considering Canyon Market is still just a small business, it was quite a feat to pull this catering job off (required coordinating with our luxury bus company, drivers, etc.). You really helped us kick our trip off on a high. Cannot recommend more highly for quality, service, and care! Thanks again!
author: Amie S.

description:
Glen Parks local grocery store. They have a good range of necessities, fresh produce, good beer, salad bar, deli, bakery, etc. The prices aren't cheap but none of the products they stock are cheap either, they are on par with Whole Food prices with the basics still competitively priced.

They also have free chips, which is probably the biggest reason why I pop in all the time. Just casually walk in with my daughter, "oh a chip? sure lets have one", do a loop, "yeah let's grab one before we go" and nonchalantly wander out, chips in hand. I did eventually feel guilty and buy a packet, still good but they taste better free ;)
author: Tristan L.

description: Just a really nice grocery store. Has most of what you'd need, community vibe, seems like a nice work culture. Their prepared foods are quite good. I especially like their fried chicken. Reserving 5 star for the unbelievable grocery store, but I'm not sure that exists in SF!
author: Aaron Z.

description: I went into the market last night with a friend visiting from Japan. We were waiting to be called from Gialina's when a table was free. It cold outside, so I thought I would show him the market while waiting. I considered buying a semolina cake, but the price had gone up from $14.95 to $19.99. Way too much. Anyway, while showing him around, he retrieves a sweatshirt from his backpack before we head to the restaurant. As we exit, an overzealous security guard stops us and asks to look in my friends backpack. We allowed him to. I was so embarrassed having to try to explain to my friend, who has only a beginners grasp of English what had just happened, what he was being accused of, and why I was so angry. I will never shop at this market again and i will make sure to tell all my friends and neighbors to stop shopping there as well.
author: Randy W.

description: Another overpriced market in San Francisco.  Didn't love it, didn't hate it because I can never get excited about $20 lunches (sandwich, drink and chips).  The sandwich was pretty tasty nevertheless and you can tell they use all fresh ingredients.  The market is quiet, quaint and clean.  Parking may be a bit of challenge in this part of town.  Over all if you're into bougie expensive yuppie markets, this will be the perfect place for you.
author: Nikole S.

description: Great neighborhood market, chock full of excellent produce and food and drink of all description. Catering to those who have something to spend, I will say that the prices aren't cheap, but hey, you're supporting a local business, the fabric of the neighborhood, as well as organic farmers and healthier foods for people and planet.
author: Tony B.

description:
Right next to public transportation and the freeway so it's a good stop to pick up a drink and breakfast on your way out. They have a good selection of baked goods, not a fan of how there is no barrier between the stock and customers, health hazard?The Chai Tea Latte is my go to along with a breakfast bacon, egg, & gouda bagel. All is delicious but it took an unusually long time for them to get the food out the last time I was there. It did not help that I was on a time schedule but it all worked out. 
Aesthetically the store is beautiful, well placed decor and vibrant colors from the fresh produce.
author: Sabrina V.

description:
let's be clear on pricing.  This place is 50% more than Haight Street Market, which is 50% more than Whole Foods, which clearly cost more than Safeway. 

It's a small neighborhood grocery store with plenty of fresh produce and specialty products.   Their wine section is small, but their cheese selection is pretty decent.  They have a deli, small fish and meat counter, and cooked food isle.

I come here for the sandwiches and occasional produce.  My favorite is the #23, Copa/salami/cheese/olive spread
author: Angelica C.

description: Thank you! Thank you! Canyon Market bakery for making my birthday celebration awesomely special. I special ordered the gluten free lemon meringue torte. What can I say, gastronomic heaven. So delicious. A day later I am still dreaming about it. Being on a gluten free diet it is so challenging finding a bakery to create a lucious tasting dessert. Now, I am so happy to have found it. Canyon Market, you rock!!! Thank you to everyone there. Fantastic food and customer service.
author: Debi L.

description: I love stopping here for gluten free baked goods! When I don't have time to make my own-- these are reasonably priced and taste great! They have a fabulous deli and cheese selection! Fun store.
author: Monica T.

description: I love this little place! Although it's quite pricey when I can swing it I think it's more than worth the price for the incredible value and quality of the items I find here. Canyon also has an awesome variety of things for me as a gf vegan freak! I love this place and the workers are so kind; Allison, Briana, Chloe, and Laura rock my world I always look forward to seeing their kind faces and I've never ever seen them not treat each other and customers with the utmost respect. This place just has good vibes man, peace love and the 8.99 salad bar
author: Lolly R.

description:
The quality of their food, from my experience and observations,  is excellent.  I Particularly like the high-quality fish they carry. Their fruit and vegetables  are excellent, the prepared food are also ver good.

The prices are too high, I recently notices that the butter that I normally buy at Molly stones is $2.40 more at canyon market. The other negative factor is the narrow isles.  Guess people want to inspect every item closely before heading to check ou
author: Sheila F.

description: Great sandwiches. A nice selection of salads with sides such as pasta, broccoli and even squid. Soups also available. Other typical supermarket fare items sold.  Vegan options available. Some items can be a bit pricey but all very good. Wonderful and friendly staff.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Cozy, costly Canyon Market is near-ish to my place & that is probably the only reason I occasionally shop here. The meat & cheese depts are fairly varied & of good quality, so there's that as well.

The bulk section, given size constraints, is limited yet they've managed to tuck in quite a few nuts, granola varities, and grains. Of course, there will always be something one might want but can't find here. Carob peanut clusters, anyone? No?

There's also a wee supplement section. I availed myself, recently, of the supplement area personnel & was helped, nicely, by someone who repeatedly mentioned how the pharmacutical industry doesn't have our best interests at heart. Fair enough, but I just wanted some Vitamin D sans side bar info., thanks.

Cashiers usually move swiftly & are personable. At the end of the transaction, you will occasionally get the 'change dump' in your hand, but that's to be expected these days as most cashiers don't/can't count back change.
author: Bea B.

description: The employees that work here are the best :). Plus they have a full organic, local coffee bar with organic dairy and stevia. Amazing! The store  is small and they have a good selection of organic and mostly local produce. Great wine selection. The only thing I wish they carried were: "Dosa chips," and unpasteurized, organic cream/butter. Most organic-boutique-type grocery stores carry both those items and for some reason they don't here. I also wish they were open a little bit later (they close at 9). Anyway, the staff are super lovely. Glad to have it as a quick stop neighborhood market for coffee and wine ! :)
author: Cassandra W.

description:
When they opened, I was thrilled for the convenience and for their focus on the good stuff (good for your body and earth). I was initially disappointed in their prepared foods (deli and bakery) but found a few favorite products there, which I'd stop by for occasionally. I can't believe it has been ten years! Now they've really improved and have become part of my shopping for staples.  Once in a while I even find awesome deals (recently loaded up on Seventh Generation dish soap). The prepared foods especially have come a long way. They have some nice new dishes (Dakar chicken!). The employees are more knowledgeable and helpful (one even explained how to make coffee to me when I had coffee-drinking visitors coming). And they have thee best fresh roasted peanut butter ever (and I've tried all the fancy shmancy stuff). 

The biggest benefit - I discovered a few months ago. I usually use BiRite for catering but will be switching over to Canyon. I ordered eighty salmon fillets for a party and they were perfectly prepared and cut just as I asked. The roasted veggie platter was wonderful too. The shrimp skewers were delicious. And working with Marina was very easy. She setup a tasting for me for the four things I was interested in. She made time during a very busy day to talk to me about the event. She was available via email for order modifications. Employees helped me carry the order to my car on pickup day. Everything was made just as I orders. A+ experience on the catering.

I also really appreciate the battery and bag recycling!
author: Marina N.

description: Great neighborhood market. Family run and very responsive to feedback. Does a lot to help out the community. Excellent lattes at the coffee bar.
author: Dan M.

description: I stopped here evertime I came to the area from the east bay..BUT NO MORE!!! I was starving and was going to buy a snack before I headed to my Dr's appt over here. I needed to use the rest room sooo bad, but they told me I couldnt. They DO NOT ACTUALLY PROMOTE WELLNESS with THAT being the case.  I REPEAT! NEVER AGAIN..I just about begged and they told me to go next door to the library..I loved this place..but NOT after that treatment!!
author: Didi S.

description: Customer service has gotten a lot better. I called to ask if they had any banana nut bread, they did, she asked me if I wanted it to be put on hold for me to pick it up, I said I did, I asked for some other things, as well. Went to pick them up, asked if they had bone broth, the lady was nice enough to leave her register to show me where all the broths were along with the homemade bone broth in the freezer section.  Good service.
author: Petra M.

description:
I visited this supermarket on alternate days for three weeks. ( Don't try to check in when you are in the store as it is a black hole when it comes to the internet)
Fruit & veg, meat, cheese, wine and breads were my main purchases. There were a couple of days where I bought their sandwiches; they were huge and if they contained meat they didn't miss. If there are two of you and you are not that hungry, sharing one sandwich would be OK.
I was surprised at the range of wines and they have taken care to give some wines quite descriptive labels. There is a spot where you can taste the wines too.
The salad and soup bar is popular at lunch time. I used it to put salads with an evening meal.
The service from the staff was excellent from walking through the door to the checkout.
A most pleasant surprise was the cappuccino coffee. There are three tables out the front of the store (best place to YELP check in ) and the coffee was good.
author: Sue L.

description:
Great food, terrible prices.  If you don't want to give your disposable income to a chain like Whole Foods, Canyon Market will take it.

I paid $30 for an apple pie one day.  I didn't realize it until I got home.  Even as it was ringing up, apparently the part of my brain that comprehends what things cost just couldn't accept that I was paying $30 for a pie.  It was delicious pie, but it was $30 pie.  That's the story of Canyon Market - delicious, but close your eyes at the checkout and just let the prices wash over you.
author: Foodbag B.

description:
I have been coming here pretty much daily since they opened. By far the best market in San Francisco, if not California. Just go in there and buy anything. The salad bar is amazing. Just combine whatever you want and it will come out mind-blowing. This place makes whole foods bar seem like safeway. The premade food at whole foods is nothing in comparison. Whole foods is many grades lower. 

I find that prices are not much more expensive than whole foods or even safeway. I find a lot of thing to cost the same. In most cases it will be a dollar or sometimes more per item than the chain stores. Most sandwiches are less than $10. Its really not that expensive considered it is all local organic quality food. 

It sounds crazy but the reason I stay where I live is because of this place. I can't see myself without it. Guess I will have to move to south France next or somewhere that offers something similar. Being able to get healthy great tasting food (premade is on par with the best city restaurants) is priceless IMO.
author: H K.

description:
So so so expensive but their soups are Delish and their salad bar is great! Lots of options and fresh toppings. 

I had their vegan artichoke soup and trust me (as a carnivore) that is was really good--one of the best I've had. 

Street parking was fairly easy around lunch time. Cutlery and napkins are by the door.
author: Semuteh F.

description: I hate grocery shopping, but I love Canyon Market. It's small, but it has everything. Also best coffee in Glen Park, and superb bakery.
author: Matvey N.

description: I really enjoy stopping in this market when I'm in the neighborhood. Everything is well stocked and tasty, but I have to take away stars for customer service. It always seems like the deli is too busy to help you. This morning I stopped in the get my niece lunch before dropping her off at school and we stood at the counter, no one greeted us or attempted to help us, I thought they might be helping someone already so I waited. Another customer walked up and one of the ladies started helping her immediately. Then when someone finally acknowledged us we ordered a hot sandwich and it was like she didn't want to make it. She kept saying that she had a lot of hot sandwiches to put in the panini press and it was going to be a long time. I kept asking her how long and she just kept pointing to the sandwiches she needed to press. She tried to push a pre-made sandwich on us, which if she would have listened to my order would not work since we wanted to mayo or mustard. I finally said ok, I understand, but how long is it going to be for our sandwich if we wait. 10 minutes, ok, great, I'll wait. She just seemed put out to do her job. The cashier was pleasant and we ended up spending way more money than I wanted wandering around the store for 10 minutes, but that was to their benefit. Don't make your customers feel like they are bothering you to do your job.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Cute little neighborhood grocery store, stocked to the nines with specialty items (cheeses, chocolates, and wines, oh my!), fresh fruits & veggies, and your basic 'essentials' that cost way more than your run-of-the-mill market.

I don't make it out here too often, and even the smallest of grocery runs results in a fairly hefty bill, but yay for supporting local businesses?

My penny pinching aside, it's worth a drop-in if you're in the area and want to grab an easy snack (they have a bomb-diggity deli) or drink.
author: Claire S.

description:
l've been coming to Canyon Market since I moved to SF almost two years ago. A big thumbs up for their convenient location to transit, genuine customer service and unique and delicious selection of organic or speciality items. It's a smaller sized market but they pack in a variety of goods including salad bar and deli station.

I must admit, I don't shop for all my groceries here as it is more pricey. I come here for speciality items or if I need some last minute items or a quick bite to take away. I think what sets them apart from the other local food markets is easy product navigating and that their customer service has always been kind and knowledgeable. 

They have a nice wine selection, great flowers, special teas & vitamins, and some tasty sweet baked goods that you can't help but pick up once in awhile. They also sell local eatery bites from places like Nucha's and Peasant Pies.
author: Nova P.

description: Great place for speciality products and very conveniently located. I found lingonberry jam here which I needed for a new recipe. Probably too expensive for the average person's everyday shop.
author: Sarem G.

description: Canyon Market is a gem to Glen Park. I don't even mind paying the extra cost because the food is that good! You can grab local ingredients to make delicious food. Lazy? Well you are in luck. They sell pre made food that is superb. The workers are efficient and always working with a smile.
author: Laurisha C.

description: This is such a great market. Their prepared foods, salad bar and soups are amazing and primarily organic and local. This is what  Whole Food used to be before they became big. Their produce and fresh meat selection is high quality. Perfect place to grab a quick bite or bring to a picnic.
author: Christine P.

description:
EXCELLENT place, I love their organic homemade soups (although they RARELY have Gluten Free AND dairy free options besides beans, Fava Bean Soup, lentil soup.. SO MUCH BEANS!!! Lol).. Turkey Kale soup is wonderful for gluten free. 
Also the bakery area doesn't have much on the gluten free options either, everything gluten free is in the freezers.. but other than that, awesome place for a quick stop and organic deli & produce area.
author: Alicia M.

description:
Let's get the obvious out of the way: this place isn't cheap. What do you expect from a local, health-conscious grocery store in a great location in a great neighborhood in the most expensive city in the country? That being said, I am willing to pay a premium to support a great local business with a great shopping experience. Among the many pros:

- The store is always clean and very well-organized, and the staff are very helpful. Even during rush hour, they move the checkout lines quickly.
- The produce is always fresh and most is organic. 
- They have a good wine and beer selection.
- They have many varieties of fresh-baked bread twice daily (this is one of the biggest reasons I come so often).
- They have a coffee bar in-store with excellent coffee from local roasters and good pastries. Additionally, their prices on craft coffee are good.
- It's right next to Glen Park BART and like 8 bus lines, so it's really useful for picking up groceries on the way home.

My only other complaint is that there is zero cell reception inside the store. But as long as I live in the area (and maybe even after) I will keep coming back to Canyon market!
author: Dale H.

description:
Delightful little market that my husband and I stumbled upon whilst popping into Glen Park on one of our "explorations" one random Saturday.  Not much to be found in Glen Park from a commercial stand-point; however, this market was such a wonderful find.  Such a hidden and unexpected gem!  So much so that we've been back multiple times - skirting down to Glen Park solely for the market.

Wonderful arrangement of various specialty/grocery items, in addition to very tasty selections of deli and bakery treats.  We've loved everything we've tried - the pre-made items are fantastic, and everything at the deli/cheese counter is extremely fresh. 

Definitely recommend stopping in!
author: Rachael S.

description: I've been coming to Glen Canyon Market for about 8 years now and it's definitely my favorite grocery store. The salad bar is great and they always have a vegetarian soup. The deli is also amazing and has quick things to pick up on the way to work. They have a lot of other specialty products like spices, vegetarian food and a nice organic healthcare area. The people who work there are always nice too.
author: Rhiannon B.

description: Love this market but pricy.. They closed n reopen few years back.. Great location n busy.. Right off glen park Bart station.. The salad bar n deli sandwich are the best.. But parking is bad.. Got luck today parked right up front !!!
author: Crisy G.

description:
I was in the neighborhood and I wondered into this market. I never heard of the market, never been in this area and was delighted by the quality of the products, the staff and the overall feel of the place.

So, I was just looking around and saw these amazing looking pork chops but I was really thinking Italian sausage but could not find them. As the butcher was about to take the chop out of the case I saw the sausage and quickly switched. When I got back home and cooked the links they were terrific. Now, other things I liked were the produce. The salad bar, in which I took with me some mozzarella balls with me were good. Behind the counter there also were some amazing looking things but I was all set. Only thing not so good was the Americano coffee that was weak and not so good.

Anyway, a great little market that I am sure the locals love.
author: Rickey B.

description:
A-OK. That's what three stars means and that's just about right when it comes to my experience shopping here.  It's been hit or miss with both food and service.

Twice I've purchased from their seafood and fish counter and twice the salmon and the shrimp had gone bad, meaning, they smelled funny.  What I should've done was gone back and asked for a refund. 

They are always out of things. When I go to their dairy section, I regularly see items out of stock. 

Their customer service people are friendly these days. I remember a time when they weren't. 

Produce has always been terrific. Always fresh, stocked and a pretty good selection. 

If you haven't tried any of their bakery items - You Must. Personal favorite is their banana cream pie. And their fresh salad bar is pretty great. 

Overall, I don't care that their prices are high or high-ish. This is San Francisco after all. Be reasonable; They have to pay rent somehow.  But I just wish the quality and consistency could go up a notch is all.
author: Katherine P.

description:
Had their iced coffee and it's fairly priced. I had 2 16oz coffees and it came out to be about $6. The coffee was strong and smooth and they didn't put too much ice so the flavor didn't dilute too much throughout the day. Definitely going to give their hot coffee a try one day.

As for the market itself? Shits overpriced. But I've always been curious of the pastries and premade food they have available. They make it look so scrumptious
author: Linda K.

description: Great food, worth the price, mainly for the salad bar and deli! Staff is super nice. Nice to keep grocery shopping simple sometimes ;) not a giant store to navigate but filled with quality stuff.
author: Ryan G.

description: Unless your cashier has pink hair, prepare to be treated like human garbage. Pretty good food, but the human garbage thing really affects the taste.
author: Katherine M.

description:
They are not THAT expensive. Whole foods pre-made food will take you for more plus leave you with gastrointestinal woe. If you can afford to live in Glen Park you can afford to shop here. 
I shop here every Thursday to stock up for my 12hr night shift work weekends. I have NEVER had any of the pre-made food look or taste questionable. I have confidence in them using high-quality ingredients. Try any of the Indian Bentos if you love spicy. I always buy the prepackaged salads and find them better quality than most grocers also the fresh made deserts which are rotated weekly so I don't get tired of anything. And I don't buy bread anywhere but here. Go before 4pm if you need parking.
author: Stanley J.

description: This is one of the most friendly grocery stores - or stores in general - you'll ever go to. First off, the people there are really nice and personable. Also, I enjoy buying healthy organic food, and this store is conveniently located in a diverse neighborhood if you wanna stop here and buy a quick bite. Or drink. Or hand sanitizer. I LOVE this store.
author: John-Paul M.

description:
I attended a painting workshop up Chenery at the Center for Creative Exploration. Canyon Market was recommended for lunch. Several of us decided to try it. They have a fabulous salad bar, great sandwiches (I loved the Pulled Pork) and hearty soups. 

Since workshop hours are long, I also stopped in for pre-made dinner items. Tonight's dinner featured their grilled salmon and snap pea salad. Wonderful.

The people who work here are kind.

Their selection of chocolate is amazing.
author: Cathy W.

description:
Great customer service for such a small market. 

Organic and local focused.

Try the amazing sandwiches!
author: Billy S.

description: I just adore this market. It's a Whole Foods only an indie one in the neighborhood. The selection is great. I love the wine selection, price (affordable) and nice selection of imports.
author: Robyn K.

description:
This place is AWESOME.  I live within walking distance and have been frequenting this place for years.  It's a bit pricy, but the place runs like a well oiled machine and you really never feel bad paying for quality products.  Especially when it comes to the food you're eating. 

Not only do they have good produce/groceries, sandwiches, but they also have some great coffee cooking up in the corner at their cafe.  Also, they sell some great San Francisco made greeting cards in the front that I always get for my friends and family.
author: Gary M.

description:
Canyon Market is my local market and I have been going there since it opened. They have the BEST fresh bread, meat counter and produce. While I totally understand how many people think it might be expensive, I myself am happy to
 pay for such great quality. The staff is super knowledgeable and friendly too.
author: Karen O.

description:
LOVE.

I've been on a pretty painful cleanse as of late and Canyon Market has been one of my go-to grocery stores for produce. I super love shopping for produce, because of all of the beautiful colors and choices, and CM does not disappoint.  It offers a high quality selection of seasonal produce to compliment, or feature, in any meal.  I scored some interesting purple yams last week that were both awesome-looking and unique-tasting.  The price of the produce is comparable to Whole Foods (read: a little high), but well worth it.  And I note that it is impossible to open CM's green plastic bags designated for produce--seriously, not easy.  I tried to buy some jalapenos and struggled for around five minutes to get the bag open.  I could feel my face burning red with embarrassment when I took a look around and saw that my co-shoppers were likewise struggling to get those bags open.  It was like a Seinfeld episode.  Finally we were told that there was something wrong with the bags and they just did not open by one of the store clerks.  Whew!  But other than that, divine produce.  

I also love the seafood counter.  Those king scallops ($30/lb-yikes!) are phenomenal.  I would like to eat those every day, please.  And the fellas working the counter are as nice as can be. 

I really like the nut bins as well.  Deez nuts are delicious and fresh.  

My favorite thing about the CM, however, is how nice everyone is.  It's not the typical ass-to-ankles rudeness you experience at Trader Joe's or Whole Foods.  This is a small, neighborhood joint, so everyone's on a first name basis.  Folks are into the niceties, saying please, thank you, excuse me, and sorry. People are even smiling! It's positively refreshing.

Cons: Parking. Good god, good luck.Just take BART-CM is  a block away from Glen Park Bart Station. Then have someone pick you up if you have a lot of loot.  Just walk a block down to Bello Coffee and have a hot peach black tea (YUM) while you wait for your ride. In addition, the space is pretty small, so it can get pretty packed at times. But even when it's packed, people seem to be pretty nice. 

Overall I love shopping at CM, because sometimes you wanna go where everybody knows your name.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Good selection of foods. Perhaps a little pricey for someone not on SF/SV money.

Had Chai Latte and bagel with cheese. Both were well prepared and very tasty.

I liked the punch cards stored in the shop by alphabetical order for their locals.

Defiantly worth a visit!
author: Chris B.

description: I love their coffee bar and their coffee beans. Nancy is awesome! The store has great positive energy. Glen Park --- my neighborhood --- is lucky to have such a great market.
author: Tomas A.

description:
I stop in here regularly, and have been for a few years now. The hot food is fantastic, especially the breakfast sandwiches and coffee. Their sandwiches are well worth the few minutes you will have to wait for them. I do agree with some of the other reviews about this market being on the expensive side- this is true, even for ordinary little things like bottled water or candy bars. And I have on more than one occasion had to bring something back to the store because it was spoiled when I purchased it- but their produce is great!

The staff at Canyon Market are friendly and helpful. And like I said, even after my complaints I stop into this market several times a week.
author: S. Z.

description:
This market has a deli counter that does prepared foods, salad bar, hot sandwiches, and soup bar.   I have tried them all over the years and they are a treat I look forward to every time I visit my aunt in Glen Park.  

The one thing I never miss are the soups.  I always seem to try something I have never seen before and the visit yesterday was no exception.  I had a cuban soup that had ham, kidney beans, bell peppers, and potatoes.  It was excellent as usual.  My wife had a lentil soup with sausage and that was also great.  

I had a hot chicken sandwich on sourdough, with guryere cheese, and grilled onions.  Also excellent.  

This place is not cheap eats but I am so happy to pay a bit extra to get such great prepared foods.  It's kinda comparable to Whole Foods prepared foods, but so much better quality and has the homemade flavors that Whole Foods seem to miss.  

They make their own breads, so even the roll that comes with the soup is excellent sour dough, and the sandwich too.
author: Paul B.

description: I really like this store location because it's close to home and very convenient. However, the prices are quite high and just not worth paying. It's too bad that they can't lower their prices to accommodate the residents who would benefit from this location.
author: Ilya K.

description:
I've witnessed this store evolve since it replaced the original food market that burned down years ago. Since its opening, this market has remained disconnected with San Francisco and its myriad of denizens. 

Today, I purchased a salad and tried to find some tape to hold the box closed while I continued to shop. Whole Foods, Andronico's, Mollie Stone, and Rainbow all have tape next to their containers so that purchased items won't come open while shopping and to enhance food safety. I mean, how much does a roll of tape cost in the grand seem of things? Bringing my items to checkout with spilled couscous and red beets in the basket, I asked the store why there's no tape and was told, "We couldn't possibly do that! You can't imagine what 'people' would do with that tape. We've seen it all." Really?  I asked if they had tried having "free" tape next to the salad bar containers and was sheepishly told no.

Small interactions like this speak volumes to the core of a consumer's experience. Going forward, I'll avoid patronizing this store unless I bring my own tape.
author: Charlie T.

description:
I think Canyon Market it best for one-offs and the occasional prepared foods. It's super cute inside and it carries the usual organic/hippie dippy suspects. However, the pricing is prohibitive, at least to someone like me who is on a budget. It's probably about 20% more than Whole Paycheck. However, if I am thirsty or don't want to find parking at another more affordable store, I will definitely stop in for one or two items.

Sadly, I will have to continue shopping at the the most depressing Safeway in the world on Monterey Boulevard.
author: Tara H.

description:
My experience with this grocery store is always pleasant, and the staff is super-friendly.  With it's limited size, they manage to fit quite a few high quality items in the store.  The cheese selection is pretty extensive, and the quality of their meat, fish, and produce is exceptional.   This is where I purchase most of my baked goods, and their French baguette is a nice compliment to their cheese selection.  

Directly below the French baguettes, sourdoughs, and other baked goods are some nice dip options ranging anywhere from humus, guacamole, to spinach artichoke dip.  The only real hassle about shopping here is the limited parking in the area.  However I'm able to find parking pretty quickly even if I have to walk a block or two.

If you've never been to this store, I would suggest you take time to pay a visit.  You will not be disappointed with what they have to offer.
author: Frank T.

description: This is a wonderful market. They don't have everything (it's tiny!), But they have most of the things you'd need to cook a nice healthy meal. Great produce and high quality meat, and by far the best bread in the area, baked fresh in store twice a day (that alone warrants five stars from me). Very good wine selection too. Highly recommended.
author: Mikkel R.

description:
Friendly staff and store is always kept tidy and clean. Well, at least the times I've been. 

I enjoy the salad bar and the other available fresh food options. The wide range of preprepared foods, cheeses, sandwiches, and their desserts/sweets are better than WF, that's for sure.
author: Esther A.

description:
I live around the corner so I know this place well. Neighbourhood-y vibe, disproportionately overpriced *everything*! Overpriced without any real reason other than because they can fleece people. So I on the rare occasion stop by for a coffee (not roasted in-house) and their decent house-made Irish soda bread scones but that's about it. I'd rather schlep to WF or TJ than overspend at this unfortunately overpriced market.

Bello down the block is a far better coffee deal - excellent coffees, great service!
author: Mick J.

description: Haha! Love this store. Did you see the 1  by Charlie T.  that said I will never come back because they have no tape..!?!? There is nothing wrong with the store just the people who shop there.
author: James M.

description: Yes this place is expensive. However, you get what you pay for.  I do not do all or even most of my grocery shopping here. It does have a wonderful selection of cheeses, breads and a fabulous takeout/deli section. This market is adorable and just fun to wander around. Not only is the customer service amazing but the customers seem to be quite lovely here as well.  Most recently, In the 15 minutes I spent at this store, I had 3 enjoyable conversations; 2 with fellow customers and one with the barista. I cannot think of the last time I actually had a pleasant time at a grocery store. Lastly this market boasts a fabulous selection of natural beauty items like lotions, bath bars and hair products. Great for gifts or when you're wanting to try something new.  I even noticed some baby care products which I'm sure all the local parents appreciate.
author: Lynsey S.

description:
I LOVE this place. Perfect stop for after work groceries, pricey, but worth it. Our family loves the chicken salad in the prepared foods. 

GREAT salad bar, Fresh flowers, great products, and a friendly staff! I sure don't mind paying for quality experience and convenience.
author: Corrie H.

description:
This place is literally as good as it gets! That said, I shop here strategically because you really can't afford to buy everything here, but I get all my meat here excluding the sausages. The wine selection is tops too!

Can't fail with this market!
author: Mr. K.

description:
It is definitely expensive, but they have a great selection and delicious prepared food items. Their onion and shallot spread is unbelievably good. I also love the guajillo salsa. The more I try, the more I like.

Solid selection of locally-roasted coffee, although the roast dates have been much too old lately. Hopefully they get it together. The Sight Glass is typically fresh (a few days old) but the Four Barrel is often weeks old. Not cool.
author: Steve P.

description:
Came to explore...holy goodness, expensiveeee...

But they do have some unique items. This place is similar to Whole Foods, Andronico's, Sprouts...etc...come if you are looking for something gourmet/want to splurge for a night. If this is your normal market, I want your job. I think I'll just stick with the Safeway up the hill or TJ's at Westlake for now...at least I won't break the bank every time I grocery shop.
author: Elaine Y.

description: This is a pricey grocery store, so it's definitely not where you should buy your kitchen staples. If you want specialty food items and beverages in Glen Park, then this is your place.  Their deli area has delicious high quality meats and cheeses and makes the best sandwiches in the area.
author: mary c.

description: Love this place. Not sure where all the bad reviews are coming from?  Great sandwiches, good wine and cheese selection and pretty much anything you would want in your local corner market.
author: Matt S.

description: Alerted the manager yesterday that their normally excellent sandwiches are soft and soggy, no reaction. Today I was trying to but some veggie sushi and they had no soy sauce. Again I  asked the manager, he simply didn't care. Another customer lost. What  its going in on?
author: Marco B.

description: Gross.  While waiting to order some sliced ham, saw employee fixing hair etc around the prepared  food and then take my order.   Assumed she  would use gloves or at least wash her hands, but no deal.  Walked out and went to molly stones.
author: Peter R.

description: Great neighborhood  market! Large selection  of moderate to high end cheeses. Delicious Mimolette cheese! Decent  selection of various wines. Homemade bread & hearty looking sandwiches which are popular, will  try those  later. Service is outstanding.
author: Ron P.

description: Following a long hike with the pup at Glen Canyon Park, I stopped in here to get a few items and found myself a little baffled by the high prices ($7 for OddWalla juice!) and limited selection. That said, the cashier was very nice and checked me out quickly, especially when I admitted that was my dog barking loudly outside. As it's the only grocery store in the neighborhood, it leaves locals to have no choice but to shop here, and while it has a very organized set-up, the pricing and limited selection leave quite a bit to be desired. Can't say I'd continue to frequent this establishment unless I'm in dire straits.
author: Kristina B.

description:
Canyon Market carries Zoe's Meats and other quality meats and fish of which we are thankful for. 

The thing that really bothers me about this place are the cashiers. It's a total 50/50 chance you will get someone who is not friendly. Cashiers don't have to tell me fake "have a nice day" one-liners, but I often get semi-rude comments and/or looks given to me by various cashiers. It's a real bummer that makes me hesitant to shop here.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I went in to grab a coffee after the farmer's market- because I think they have the cutest coffee bar- & they never dissapoint in that category.. Pretty sure it's always local/organic/fair trade coffee too & that makes me happy. 

As for non-caffeine items.. I like their skincare lines and products, especially the mad hippy exfoliating serum.

Their weekly sales are really good especially on smoothies and cold pressed juices. The food that is NOT on sale may be a little more expensive than WF's but only by a matter of cents which I can't complain about. If I had to choose, I prefer to put my $ towards smaller places like this rather than places that are more corporate.

$10: I picked up a cup of coffee (lol) 
          Organic Bananas
          1/4 lb. of roasted brussel sprouts
          1/4 lb. of pesto penne pasta
author: Ferrarah D.

description:
This is a great little grocery store in the heart of Glen Park.  Parking is difficult because there's no parking lot.  Only street parking - metered unless you go deeper into the neighborhood.  The outside of the store has a great variety of fresh cut flowers.  They even sometimes have Farm Girl Flowers which I LOVE!

The vibe reminds me of a Whole Foods or Mollie Stone's but 1/3 the size.  Canyon Market has a great selection of baked goods, already-prepared food, and organic items.  They even have good fresh baked bread, and a salad bar.

The only thing I don't like about it is that it's so pricey.  You can't find the great sales or Buy 1 Get 1 Free deals here like you can at Safeway.  But I can guarantee that you will get a much better grocery experience here than Safeway.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
VERY EXPENSIVE. Definitely don't do your whole shopping here unless you have the budget. 

I live in Glen Park so it's very convenient, I have to admit. 
I usually come to grab some dinner at the salad bar, which I though was very nice the first times, but they never ever change anything about it - same exact food every day of the week! BOOOOOOOORING!

The fruits are good though, and they have those great morning muesli buns that I have to say are to die for.
author: Carole P.

description:
Canyon Market is one of the best places to go to in Glen Park. The staff members are friendly and helpful.

2/21/2013
Friendly staff working here and the items are very appropriately priced. This store is very convenient for people who live nearby. Whether you live nearby or you happen to be in the area, this is the store to go to if you want to purchase some groceries before going home. It's nice to have Canyon Market here in Glen Park.

I do like the hearty salad bar they have here cause if you or anyone is trying to be health conscious, then feel free to check it out. The soups available here are always satisfying and it is perfect for cold days or when you are craving for something warm. I love how they have a section for warm soup, salad, pasta and sandwiches. I am absolutely a fan of the salad bar so I'll definitely come here again.

3/22/2013
The salad and soup bar is worth every visit. I came here today for the salad bar since this is always a healthy meal alternative. Friendly staff and very efficient customer service so I'm definitely coming here again.

01/28/2014
I decided to come in here to get a box of salad today and walked through the aisles. To my surprise, I found an aisle where they carried Pocky Chocolate Biscuit Sticks by Glico. Props for carrying this snack food in the inventory

Overall, efficient services, friendly staff members and positive experiences so I'll definitely be back.
author: Bennett W.

description: Great spot in Glen Park! Fresh seasonal local produce pack all their wonderful items in this small store. The meat and poultry, and deli departments are all great. They also have an extensive cheese section. The salad bar is even better. It is pricey, but the warm staff and exceptional items here make this a gem to do your shopping. Allow time for street parking.
author: Moses G.

description: Cute neighborhood whole food market nestled in downtown Glen Park, right off the Bart Station. They have a surprising variety of super fresh produce and artisan items (cheese, lox, local fresh peanut and almond butters, bulk grains and spices...). They also have a salad and prepared food bar, and a sandwich and coffee shop. I would definitely be a frequent customer if I lived nearby, it's a far superior option to 90% of the neighborhood markets. As you would expect though, items cost 1.5-2x more than at Trader Joes (I know, unfair comparison), so Canyons is nice but not a destination grocery store for me.
author: Jess C.

description: Canyon Market is an excellently curated local grocer (kudos to their buyer!) in the village of Glen Park.  Shelves are stocked with favorite local (Tommaso's pasta sauce) and international products (Rigoni di Asiago Organic Hazelnut spead).  The deli (#23 sandwich is life changing) and prepared foods case are unique and freshly made.  Quality of meat and fish exceeds the premium chain grocery stores and the cheese selection is fairly good as well.  House-cured bacon is a real treat, though a bit pricey.  Depending on the time of year, produce, however, can be hit or miss.  Given its smallish footprint, you won't get a dozen variations of the same thing, just the best!
author: Ronald C.

description: Mostly this review is for the service that I don't receive.  From the cashiers who lack personality, care or concern to the coffee guy.  I mean seriously, show some customer service.  I've been here about 6 or 7 times and it's always the same.  The ONLY reason why I go there is because I can pick up some salad to go and wine.  Otherwise, I'd go to the ghetto Safeway (at least they are friendly there).  Try harder!
author: Ryan B.

description:
I tell people that it is like a mini Whole Foods, but there's a certain quality it possesses being a small neighborhood market that a giant like Whole Foods will never have. 

The cheese and beer selection are fantastic. That's what you'll usually find me visiting for. The prepared foods in the deli are stellar as well. Makes for a quick meal supplement when you really don't feel like cooking.
author: Tinna H.

description:
A seriously what's up find in the Glen Park hood if you are waiting for the BART and want a quick bite to eat. Their sandwich selection is something else - ranging from fresh veggie to turkey and cranberry - all piled on top of freshly baked bread. 

Once you go inside you're pretty much guaranteed to be walking out with something. Their tantalizing baked goods section with cranberry blondies, fresh creme brûlée, pecan rolls and gooey brownies will have you pining for dessert - no matter what time you come here. 

If fresh pasta and fragrant smelling pasta sauces are your thing - come to Canyon. If crispy plump snow peas and Roma tomatoes in sesame sause are your thing - come to Canyon. If baked what noodles drizzles in sweet sesame sauce and almonds are your thing - come to Canyon. If butternut lasagne bound in rosemary is your thing - come to Canyon. 

If eating incredible food and experiencing outstanding customer service  is your thing - Canyon is the spot.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
A typically SF grocery, everything organic, everything delicious, but of course on the spensy side.

The salad bar and deli are AMAZING!  Love the sandwiches, and they have a decent selection of beer and wine.  A great selection of cheeses as well as awesome home made dips etc.

Its usually pretty clean and the staff are super friendly.  Clipped then one point cos its a little pricey.
author: Julie B.

description:
Woo hoo. Wow, this place is a find! Super clean small neighborhood market. Great assortment of foodie items, cheeses, great salad bar, and also...awesome sandwich menu! The 5 of us had different sandwiches, and each one of us LOVED our sandwich. 
Customer service is also great. A true find!
author: Amy O.

description:
I lived around the corner from Canyon for about 2-1/2 years. At first, it was great. They have a variety of prepared food that is delicious and convenient on those days when you don't have time/energy to cook. They also carry pretty good foodstuffs on a regular basis. The staff is typically great; they get to know all the locals and greet you with a smile.

The major downside is the price. This place is about 15-20% more expensive than Whole Foods on average. That said, there is zero competition in Glen Park for groceries. There are no alternatives unless you want to get in the car and drive to WF in Noe or head over to the decrepit Safeway on Monterey (one of the more depressing grocery stores in the city).
author: Randy N.

description:
This store serves a very important need in the neighboorhood - good, healthy produce and meat.   And I find the owner (lady) absolutely delightful and helpful - ask her about the cheese...  But sadly some of the prices are seriously ridiculous.  Like today, $7 for a head of califlower!  A similar size was $4 at Whole Foods and less than that at the Farmer's Market around the corner.   This is not unusual.  Prices can be whacky whacky whacky - no rhyme or reason which makes their gouge-like pricing very, very suspect.  There's a couple of good deals there but not many.  

Glen Park is still a diverse neighborhood and I'd love to see Canyon Market serve the whole community a bit better than than just the the new rich that have moved into the neighborhood and can afford that super special cauliflower.  Molly Stones is only about a mile and a half away and, though pricey as well, it is cheaper as well as more consistent and stable.

Finally, the worker kids are getting better, much better.  There was a long stretch from the start where this place hired young people ruder than the team at Rainbow... and that's rude.  But they really have grown up a bit and had some additional training...  Good job on that.
author: William T.

description:
I have ordered lunch catering for work numerous times from Canyon Market, and every time my group raves about how amazing the food is. Julie is a dream to work with, replying quickly to my emails and helping to tailor a new menu to my group every time. 

Logisitics:
- Catering can be easily ordered by phone or over email, and they send you a confirmed menu/invoice via email
- They use an outside delivery service that always gets my food to me on time
- They provide food placards to place in front of every item, so that your guests know what they are eating. Previously, these were hand-written, but the last time I ordered, they were pre-printed and included all of the ingredients on them! This is incredibly helpful when you have a group of people with numerous food allergies. (They also label the vegetarian/vegan/gluten-free options)
- The baked goods are amazing!

Overall, Canyon Market is one of my favorite places to order catering from, due to their delicious, high-quality food and efficient, helpful service.
author: Victoria W.

description:
We stayed around the corner from here when we were in SF for a week. 

Good selection of organic products, but we mainly came here for the soup, salad bar and the cooked foods.

Loved the selection and food was pretty good. Staff are super friendly and always chatty!

A little pricey compared to the larger chains, but a great local market nonetheless.
author: Vic T.

description:
This place is really exciting if food and cooking excite you. Or if the words "organic", "all-natural", or "fair trade" make your heart pitter patter. 

It's a pretty small grocery store, but there's lots of good stuff packed into here that's clearly been chosen with a lot of care. Lots of things are overpriced, like produce and bread, but everything is of great quality. They've got a good selection of natural beauty care products with some brands I haven't seen in any of the chain stores, as well as some really nice oils, vinegars, alcohols, ice creams.... 

I went the other day to pick up a $100 gift card my grandma had apparently called in for me and had a great time buying stuff I usually wouldn't spring for because I'm on a budget. I didn't get much for that $100, about a bag worth of stuff.... but those products/ingredients yielded the best chocolate cookies I've ever made and some pretty tasting dipping oil/vinegar for my bread at dinner time :)
author: Meryl S.

description:
When I first moved to Glen Park, I hailed Canyon Market as the Berkeley Bowl of Glen Park.  Local flavor, healthy eats, small neighborhood market.  

This grocery store certainly has character, but if you aren't careful, you will wind up spending a LOT of money.

THE GOOD STUFF:

If you come here once, get THE DELI SANDWICHES. Heaven on earth I'm telling ya.  I cannot resist the #6 chicken breast and gruyere sandwich. Let me dissect this for you:

- Hot and toasty focaccia bread with a perfectly soft bite
- Expertly layered sauteed red onions.  The caramelization is wonderful.
- Gooey gruyere
- Tender chicken breast
- Crispy pancetta(!!!)

The textures and flavors at play in this sandwich make me drool as I write this review. 

I would like to say that this is the *best* sandwich to get based on my sampling of the other sandwiches, but I am afraid that I am too hooked on #6 that I have not tried the others!  If I have, they are not quite as memorable.  That is my recommendation for you.

If you come here occasionally, the baked goods, cheese, wine, and dips are superb and all gourmet.  Worth the splurge.  If you're lucky, they put out cheese and dip samples for customers to graze as they shop - Costco style. ;) 

I'LL PASS...

Dinner in?  There are plenty of take-out places in the city and Canyon Market... unfortunately, you do not top my list.  A dinner for two set me back quite a bit: crabcakes (rather huge!), cochinita pivil (pork shoulder), and prawns were some of the top recommended choices.  The meal was of excellent quality, don't get me wrong, but I probably could have gone to a restaurant to order these dishes and paid about the same with less work to heat everything up.

Produce and non-perishables are simply not worth it for me.  The produce looks polished to perfection, but really...I'll pass on the pricey tomato and settle for one at the Mission grocery stories.

In conclusion, pick your battles wisely at Canyon.  Hopefully this review helps you find the best and tastiest without breaking the bank!
author: Kathleen W.

description:
It's bizarre to me that so many people are upset over the pricing at Canyon Market. There are copious low priced markets in San Francisco, which is not what Canyon Market is, nor what it aspires to be. This is a high-end market for people who expect quality and are happy to pay for it. I live in the Mission, where I can get discounted groceries every day. (And don't get me wrong - I most certainly relish being able to buy all of my product for a week for $15 on 24th street). However, I recently found Canyon Market on a trip to visit a Glen Park resident, and it is my new love. I will gladly drive to Canyon Market to pick up my fresh fish, pork and beef, and will feel better about the choices I'm making, regardless of the dent in my pocketbook. 

Plus, have you tried their egg salad with olive tapenade and prosciutto sandwich? I mean, give me a f*cking break. That thing is ridiculous. I would never have thought to put those three ingredients together, and now I'm craving it as I write this. 

So come on, people. If you want discount groceries, go to a discount grocery store. If you want to give all of your hard-earned money to a massive corporation, go to Whole Foods. But if you, like me, appreciate a Mom/Pop store with a great selection, hand-picked proteins, bulk items and freshly-made sandwiches, then embrace the fact that we are lucky enough to have a market like Canyon. I certainly do.
author: Mel H.

description:
A nice, cozy, neighborhood grocer that seemed to pride themselves on great customer service and good products.  The latter remains true but something happened to the former.  

I've noticed some teenage/young adult employees lately.  Some pose no issues and are quite nice.  Others are mirroring the careless, rowdiness found at chain groceries.  One time at checkout, I was done paying and asked for a bag.  Unfortunately, the cashier completely tuned out as soon as he put my money in the register as he hopped over the wall and pranced toward the exit, leaving me high and dry.  His co-worker was nice enough to hand me the requested bag while chasing down his comrade to inform him of his idiocy.  

In another instance, I was looking for a particular beauty item they didn't seem to carry.  I asked if they could order it, a request that was happily met by their jotting down the name in their books.  Afterward, I was told I could expect it in about 2 weeks.  2 weeks later, it still wasn't there.  I flagged down a staff member to investigate.  The result showed my request wasn't even in the books despite the enthused pen to paper action weeks prior.  I was then offered to have my request taken again.  I didn't bother.  I didn't want to be mislead and sent on another roller coaster ride of anticipation. 

These issues aside, their house-made products are pretty good.  Also, they have a great customer satisfaction/return policy on them.  If you didn't like what you bought, bring it back (not fully digested or used) and get a refund.
author: Honest J.

description:
Definitely not the place to get all your groceries at but is a beautifully appealing gourmet neighborhood market. This is right up the street from me and I more often than not end up here for last minute recipe needs or just something from their ready-made bar or a bottle of wine. Here are my favorite things to get at Canyon Market (vs. at Safeway): 

- Wine. They have a pretty good price range of wines. One of my favorite wines is a Malbec that they sell for $6.99. The most expensive bottle I've seen here was probably around $30.

- Cheese. Amazing cheese selection. It's heavenly.

- Ready to eat food. Their ready to eat bar is far superior to that of Whole Foods', in my opinion. Garlic sauteed prawns, butternut squash risotto, quinoa and spinach risotto, etc. 

- Bread and sweets. Fresh baked, delicious. 

Be prepared to say, "I'm sorry, how much did you say that was?!" at the counter.
author: Sonya Z.

description:
This is a cute gourmet grocery store not far from the Glen Park BART station. For a relatively small space, it's impressively well-stocked and carries everything from handmade soaps to bulk bins to olive oil samples to dried seaweed. Not to mention your vegan, gluten-free desserts on display (if you're looking for that sort of thing).

It's a nice treat to shop here if you're not on a tight budget (or any budget, in fact), and you're looking for something special or gourmet. Otherwise, I wouldn't be able to afford shopping here on any regular basis. You're much more likely to find me at the Safeway down the street or at a TJ's. 

The cashier who rang us up was super friendly and chatty. I imagined he and I were momentarily bonding over being one of the few POCs in the store (or maybe that's my projection). It was unfortunately the other shoppers who had attitude, e.g. stepping right in front of me, inches away, without a glance or an apology. People, just because you have money to shop here doesn't mean you have to be rude about it!
author: T. K.

description:
This is not some place I can go for my every day grocery shopping. It is not cheap and it's neighborhood store sized so there is only so many things they can stock. However, as a specialty shopping experience it's great.

I love their bread choices. An everyday baguette seems like something special because it's so yummy, and the more unique varieties are even better.

There's a wide range of cheeses that I don't see anywhere else. I've found many new favorites there.

The salad bar is varied. Sometimes I use it to create a salad and sometimes I use it to get some specialty items like dolmas or pasta salads.

And I almost always get something from the deli when I go. Plenty of good choices either as a meal to go or a side dish to something I make for dinner.
author: Linnea J.

description:
All hail hippy/hippster marketing!
Over priced Everything.

This is like the old Co-Ops of yesteryear.  Except you get robbed blind at this place.
Only good thing about it is the wine department.
Some relatively inexpensive exotics. Or expensive ones if you choose.
The meat department is good, but I'd rather buy Gold Bullion with my paycheck.

There are more employees than customers blocking the one-foot wide aisles, and the service sucks organic crab apples. Two cashiers discussing Game of Thrones or some nonsense throughout my checkout?  Sorry to disturb you.

And yea.  I do pick up the odd spice or cod-liver now and then for the past three years, so I know what I'm talking about.

Hype
author: e a.

description:
I try not to go there much because it's very expensive, but I can't seem to stay away because they have a fantastic salad bar - it's full of the normal veggies you'd expect as well as freshly prepared options including grilled/marinated tofu, red potato salad, grilled chicken, quinoa salad, couscous, orzo, spaghetti, roasted veggies, dolmas, and more. Yummm

I give their salad bar 5 stars and the rest of the place 2. Overall I'd say 3.5.
author: Roxy B.

description:
I really like this place.  Not very big, but they do pack a lot in.  And practically everything taste good.  Whole Food just opened up 2 months ago just a few blocks away.  I have never been there and not sure I will go when I have most everything I need here.  

Love the fresh bread and deli counter.  The sandwiches are fantastic.
author: brett b.

description:
I *have* to walk by this store at least twice a day to go to and from Bart. It's probably a good thing everything is so expensive otherwise I'd be in there all the time.  The prepared food and salad bar is amazing when you want something fast and relatively healthy. 

The friendly staff is a nice bonus and extra kudos to the deli staff who let me just stare at the prepared food items without buying anything.  One staff member even remarked, "I understand" when I told him I was just staring.
author: Austin S.

description:
One word: Expensive.

But definitely worth it ha!

I only come here when I'm in the neighborhood, and only for their deli sandwiches. Extremely delicious, they never fail. The salad bar is nice too, and they always have tasting trays everywhere. 

Everything else is expensive. If you don't have the money, or are always on a budget, this isn't the place for you, it will break your bank.Even though everything is a smaller selection,  but their quality of meat, produce, and bakery is by far the best. 

Staff is great! Go bear!
author: Nika K.

description:
Great little gourmet grocery store.  The staff is exceptionally friendly!  I recently moved to the Glen Park area and discovered this is a great place to get lazy dinner. 

The deli is yummy, and the salad bar always has a healthy and satisfying variety.
author: Aimee D.

description:
Stock pile.

Afternoon sun was not as warm as promised. Craving something heart, warm and filling. Something like turkey pasta soup.

Various veggies and the bird simmered in a turkey stock. Tomato sauce added a richness and flavor. Was a delicious answer to my craving.

Only distracted when taking bites of divine grilled tofu in black bean soy sauce. And sampling the rocky road cheesecake that was to be saved for later. Most of it at least.

Earlier in the day stopped in for a smooth Americano with just the right amount of sugar free vanilla syrup and fruitful parfait with excellent house granola.

Breakfast, lunch, dinner and dessert. You'll want to stock up.
author: Jason B.

description: When I first walked in this market, my mind automatically thinks yuppie market. Me being an anti-yuppie and anti-hip kinda guy I really wanted to dislike this place. But then I tried some of the quality food that comes from this place, and despite the prices being on the higher side, I can't help but think it's worth every penny. I come here for lunch a lot, I order I believe the #19 sandwich. The melty cheese over good quality turkey, with thick slices of bacon with this unbelievable sundried tomato spread deliciousness. One of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten. Along with my sandwich I usually grab a chicken macaroni salad which completes the meal perfectly. How can I hate on this place, it pretty freakin good.
author: Michael L.

description:
3.5 stars

Canyon Market leaves much to be desired but it is pretty much the only little grocery store in Glen Park. Wah, wah, wah. For its size, I would say that the produce selection is impressive. The toiletry section needs a bit of work. Like, why did it take me ten minutes to find shaving lotion?! I even had an employee help me out. 

PLUSES:
+ Impressive queso section. (That's Spanish for CHEESE.) 
+ Friendly and attentive deli people.
+ Healthy salad bar. One side for making your own salad and another for foods. 
+ Warm soup.
+ Impressive beer selection.
+ Carries local skincare products.
+ Pretty flower selection outside.

MINUSES:
- Expensive. Canyon Market, why do you hurt my wallet so?!
- Limited options for toiletries.
- Salad bar is COLD. No warm food, except for the soup.
- Only one soup option that was veggie friendly last night. Carrot ginger with tofu. Ugh. I didn't even bother.
author: Ileana H.

description:
Canyon Market is not the place to get your basics: eggs, butter, milk because the prices of those items (along with most other things in the store) have been grossly marked up.

Canyon Market, a Glen Park specialty grocer, sells local San Francisco sweets such as Kika's Treats & Clairsquares. Their chocolate selection is impressive, but they don't carry anything you won't find at most Whole Foods, Mollie Stones or at Bi Rite Market (Vosges, Green & Blacks, Scharffen Berger, etc.) And upon walking in, it's hard to miss their various cookies, which sit real pretty in glass jars. 

Because I don't know my way around the kitchen, my favorite section is their well stocked prepared foods area. My favorite sandwich is "The Continental"- smoked turkey, brie, red onions & mustard served warm on a baguette ($6.99.) 

I skip the salad bar, the produce section & other everyday essentials (all of which can be bought for much cheaper at Trader Joe's or Safeway)--the only thing I ever come in here for are the sweets & the sandwiches.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I like supporting small local shops, but I also like it when small local shops don't take your support for granted. This place is a rip!!! If they didn't try to bend you over every time you go in the store I would have given them more stars and would do more shopping here... With the Alemany Farmers Market so close, I am not sure why anyone would buy fruit and veggies here. 

*One extra star for the deli and the hot food section, their sandwiches are good and workers are pretty nice.
author: MishEddie G.

description:
I have since moved from my awesome hometown of San Francisco, but once upon a time I lived within walking proximity to the coolest fancy-schmancy store to ever exist.  What made Canyon Market so great?  In two words: Vegetable Lasagna.  

It is by far the best lasagna I have ever had the joy of eating and I don't even like eggplant, but I gobble every veggie in this.  I have no idea how they make this so amazing, but it is vegetarian crack.  Or perhaps there is lard.  I am a sucker for lard and the top layer of mushrooms with melted cheese that is perfectly broiled brown on top.  

In fact, all the pre-made food is outstanding.  Plus, everyone I know who has tried their grilled cheese claims it's the best.  Best is hard to beat.  

I love and miss Canyon Market.
author: Justine D.

description:
I come mainly for the salad bar which is the best I've found so far in the area.

My quibbles are that goods seem to be uniformly overpriced - you could walk over to the excellent Cheese Boutique the next street over and find some of the same products priced lower, soooo  Canyon is really banking on the yuppy factor and lack of a decent standard grocery near the BART.  If you drive here, just be prepared to potentially go driving ninja (esp. on the weekend) and have to circle blocks.

Also, very claustrophobic and not in a comfortable way - I typically get bumped at least once or twice by uncoordinated & sour-pussed shoppers.  It's one of those get-in, get-out experiences not conducive to relaxing.  And, oh dear, the line can be super sloooooow during peak hours.
author: Femita J.

description:
Lately, my appetite for soups have increased, not just for your Campbell's variety, but of a pretty wide range.  From hot and sour soup, beef noodle soup, and jook (Chinese porridge) to the creamy (Clam Chowder, mushroom bisque, etc.) and hearty (chicken and vegetable, Minestrone, etc.), if the flavor piques my interest, a sale is happily made.  Here, they offer three to four hot selections daily.  With the late winter that we're going through, this is the perfect remedy to get through those cold nights... other than that precious bed mate.  I recently took home pints of their corn chowder, clam chowder (see a slight pattern?), and chicken vegetable.  I love the fact that they have a full list of ingredients on each soup name card. The only downside is that, if you arrive late in the day, they may run out of your selection or, worse yet, the pot is picked through leaving the remaining stock short of the prime ingredients (shaking fist at those inconsiderate patrons).  
Besides offering a decent variety of produce and grocery items, this market has a full deli, salad bar, fresh meats, and seafood sections.  This store is easily accessible by MUNI, BART, and parking on the streets is not too difficult.  Brings true meaning to "neighborhood store"!
author: Mike C.

description:
After visiting this local grocery store several times, I've decided that I will no longer patron it.  

The produce is consistently old and wilting.  At those marked up prices, surely it's possible for them to rotate their produce more frequently?  Additionally, the rest of their items are outrageously overpriced to the point where it feels like I'm begging to be violated just by shopping here.  I realize it's a local market and they have competition (especially with Whole Foods on Ocean being relatively close) but their low quality standards does not justify the marked up prices.  

The customer service was equally as shitty.  The cashier wanted me to walk back to the dairy area to switch out my bottle of milk because a tiny sticker was blocking the barcode.  How about using your brain and just quickly peeling off the sticker?  Honestly, I am glad that he asked me to switch out the bottle of milk because that was when I realized it was being spoiled out the next day.  I should have noticed earlier but whatever.
author: Steph S.

description:
TWO and a HALF Stars. Cold marinara on lettuce--Would you eat it? This review is mostly for their sandwiches, although the market in general would also get 2.5 stars.

The atmosphere is nice and upscale, erratic, tight aisles, yummy samples. Lacks variety. Definitely not a place for bargains, but has organics and boutique items. Pleasant staff. 

When I first came in the meat/fish guy behind the counter boasted that they have better sandwiches than BiRite Market--Um, Nooooo. That's not true: I had two sandwiches today and aside from the yummy fresh baguette and focaccia, the ingredients and the execution of the sandwich was very lackluster. Does not make me want to pay $7 and $10 for sandwiches there again. 

A great sandwich you can taste all of the ingredients in harmony and the star of the show is the filling/protein whether it be meat, fish, cheese or veggies. The two I had today were not great. My criticisms:

- Crab Cakes Sandwich: Mostly disappointing. Crab Cakes aren't very crabby and tasted like filler. Too many red onion and on top of that the red onions were cooked well or right. They slices were too big and there were tough leathery and flavorless pieces of onion. The onion was everywhere--they was the second biggest component after the crab cakes. The spread was good but not much of it. They served the sandwich on sourdough baguette which is a little bit of an odd choice because the crabcakes are soft and end up shooting out of the sandwich when you bite into the chewy baguette. DISAPPOINTING.

- Veg and Havarti: I was excited to try this because it has sundried tomato spread on it. I used to adore the sundried tomato pesto on the brie sando at Big Sherm's in the Lower Haight back in the day. However, this sundried tomato spread was blah. First of all it was ice cold on my sandwich. And, instead of having an olive oil base in the spread it was somewhat watery which made it taste like marinara. No bueno. So, imagine cold, marinara on lettuce and cucumbers and fresh mealy tomatoes--that was in the sandwich! That sounds unappetizing, doesn't it? The thinnest slice of havarti on the planet is in there, too. That cheese looked like paper. Aside from the wonderfully fresh focaccia bread this sandwich was a FAILURE.

Maybe, I'll try another sandwich, hopefully, something other reviewers are raving about, but I'm not rushing back here for a sandwich.
